intro: Mazeutoxeron rufum, commonly known as the red-stemmed mazeutoxeron, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces tiny, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
